#summary How to setup various tools needed to run inspire-foss software
#labels Phase-Deploy

= Introduction =

The software from the inspire-foss project does not consist of an executable program. Rather there are various scripts and configurations that use a variety of Free and Open Source Software tools and components. This section lists the various tools required, with some guidance how to set things up. This setup has been tested/performed on Unix-like systems like Mac OSX and Ubuntu Linux. All tools are also available for the Windows OS-family (XP, 7 etc).

= The Tools =

Below all required and some optional tools are listed that are needed to run inspire-foss scripts.

== Core Tools ==

  * [http://java.sun.com Java], recent version 6 or higher
  * [http://subversion.tigris.org/ Subversion] (SVN) client latest
  * [http://maven.apache.org Apache Maven2], a build/run tool
  * [http://ant.apache.org Apache Ant], a build/run tool (OPTIONAL)


== Transformation ==

  * [http://gdal.org GDAL/OGR with PROJ], 1.7.3 or higher
  * [http://http://xmlsoft.org/XSLT/xsltproc.html XSLTProc] fast XSLT processor
  * [http://www.gnu.org/software/libiconv/documentation/libiconv/iconv.1.html iconv], character conversion (OPTIONAL)

== Database ==

  * [http://postgres.org PostgreSQL], 8.3 or higher
  * [http://refractions.postgis.net PostGIS], recent version
  * [http://sourceforge.net/projects/phppgadmin phppgadmin], recent version (OPTIONAL)

== Web Services ==

  * [http://deegree.org deegree], latest, is downloaded automatically via Maven
  * [http://apache.org Apache HTTP server], latest, downloaded OPTIONAL

= Installation =

== Linux (Ubuntu/Debian) ==
 
Most tools are easily installed using the "apt" program. Below some specifics.

== Core Tools ==

Usually Java from OpenJDK comes preinstalled. 
To install Java from Sun, ahem Oracle, see
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/3747789/how-to-install-sun-jdk-on-ubuntu-10-10-maverick-meerkat

  * update /etc/apt/sources.list (uncomment "partners" stuff)
  * apt-get install sun-java6-bin sun-java6-jdk sun-java6-jre
  * still openjdk prevails: reconfigure alternatives
  * update-java-alternatives -l (list)
  * update-alternatives --config java

Others

  * apt-get install maven2
  * apt-get install subversion
  * apt-get install apache2

== Transformation ==

Installing a recent GDAL version is trickier, as Ubuntu/Debian
repositories may contain older versions. Also (at least for the Netherlands) some tweaking of Proj is required.

Best is to use "ubuntugis" packages. To enable  
add lines below to  new file `/etc/apt/sources.d/ubuntugis.list`

{{{
deb http://ppa.launchpad.net/ubuntugis/ubuntugis-unstable/ubuntu maverick main 
deb-src http://ppa.launchpad.net/ubuntugis/ubuntugis-unstable/ubuntu maverick main 
deb http://ppa.launchpad.net/ubuntugis/ubuntugis-testing/ubuntu maverick main 
deb-src http://ppa.launchpad.net/ubuntugis/ubuntugis-testing/ubuntu maverick main 
apt-key adv --keyserver keyserver.ubuntu.com --recv-keys 314DF160
apt-get update
}}}
